column8: text

PR won Kedah and Perak in GE12, but lose them both by GE13. Many of my Kedah and Perak friends working here in SG tell me that it is highly possible!   Which makes me ponder if it is possible for the PH to win 4 states...But there are some factors to consider:(+) Kedah and Perak people have lower trust in BN over the 1MDB Scandal.(+) Kedah and Perak urban population have increased, and urban population tend to vote opposition.(+) Dr M pulling in Malay votes.(+) Increased confidence in PH after seeing Penang's and Selangor's development.(-) No more PAS support. 3 way fight possible. BN benefit on average.(-) PH internal bickering.(-) Bad history of PR's governance.Do you think the opposition got a chance to win back Perak and Kedah this coming election?
no. pas oredi kenot win kelantan.ph jauh sekali.

Kedah and Perak people have lower trust in BN over the 1MDB Scandal - only among most non-malays..most malays dun give a hood about this 1MDB thingy. especially in state level where they mostly will focus more on state issues..i guess PH-fag still didnt learn from their big mistake in Sarawak state election & recent DUN by-electionsIncreased confidence in PH after seeing Penang's and Selangor's development - well..i beg to differ..maybe Penangites do have no problem with DAP but the same cannot be said at current situation where LGE at helm..there's a talk on the ground in Penang that Penangites have no confidence towards LGE/LKS anymore..Selangor is much worse..i guess next GE result will be fair between BN & PH+PAS..PH might win in SOME urban or cainis majority place but the same cant be said on other places than thatDr M pulling in Malay Votes - this is the biggest overestimated judgement in most PH-fag, especially those non-malays, where they keep on convinced heavily that Dr M is indeed have the big influence over malays..its a terribly wrong judgement & PH-fag will realize it during next GE..this "screw melayu (by using mahathir) to screw melayu" is not going to work in malay majority area..if it fails in Sarawak, what more in peninsular..the sooner PH awake from their dream & start to look at things more realistically the better

A couple of mate of my who is deep in the corporate world ( lawyer/auditor ) claim that it was just some financial thing gone haywire and the news pusing into something else. It is no surprise for government investment thing to go wrong but there is plenty of cash inside EPF anyway, plenty.Depends on who u ask but the most interesting answer i heard is BIJAN is doing a fantastic job in countering all those attacks led by an old man, and is doing a fine job steering the ship financially or economically wise, we are a small country and he make a great decision of being friends with everyone who offers money and help. This answer is from a lawyer who mainly deals with acquisition/merging for corporates or GLC/MNC companies.Some unker age auditor friend claim it was x10 worst during mamaktir times, it will make what we see now as child's play. Basically one old man ruin it for everyone in this country, and the guys after him have to work OT to patch up the hemorrhaging wound that is still hemorrhaging to a few lucky individual.My answer is simple, if you are not in the elite family of the country, u came out from the wrong vag. Since it is the wrong vag already, the way not to be suck into being poor is work your hardest to not being poor. The rest matter later.Those people who become elite, they work very hard, in a different way but yes they do work really hard way pass 9-5 to get where they are today, although sometimes they make u feel like things just fall from the sky for them. My boss is one example.

I have been following Malaysian politics in depth since I was 11 years old for the past 20 years.In my opinionBN has 3 challenges at the moment:1. DAP reelection : requested rectification by ROS of party election fraud 4 years ago was not implemented.2. Jailing LGE 3. Jailing Tun M or chase him out country during election time period.If DS Najib is successful in implementing all the three criterias, BN should comfortably win 2/3 -70% of parliamentary seats due to1.Fractured opposition with no credible leader2.Gerrymandering by Election Council favoring BN3.Malaysia's 2017 GDP growth of 5-5.3%.
